New Records: Cleveland ended a streak of 11 losses in postseason elimination games dating to Game 6 of 1997 World Series.
David Fry hit the second pinch-homer in Cleveland postseason history after Hank Majeski in Game 4 of the 1954 World Series.
Key Match Events: David Fry had a go-ahead, two-run homer in the seventh inning.
Fry bunted home an insurance run in the ninth.
Zach McKinstry homered in the fifth inning.
Wenceel Pérez hit a run-scoring single in the sixth inning.
Emmanuel Clase retired five batters, preserving a 4-3 lead in the eighth when he escaped a second-and-third jam by striking out Trey Sweeney on a 100.9 mph cutter.
Justyn-Henry Malloy doubled leading off the ninth, advanced on Parker Meadows' groundout and scored on Jace Jung's groundout.
Clase struck out Matt Vierling for the save.
Pre-Game Insights: Game 5 is Saturday in Cleveland, with ace Tarik Skubal set to start for the Tigers.
The winner advances to the ALCS against the New York Yankees starting Monday.
